chapter.title: Index Optimization
chapter.para: From time to time, the Lucene index needs to be optimized. The process is essentially a defragmentation. Until an optimization is triggered Lucene only marks deleted documents as such, no physical deletions are applied. During the optimization process the deletions will be applied which also effects the number of files in the Lucene Directory.

Optimizing the Lucene index speeds up searches but has no effect on the indexation (update) performance. During an optimization, searches can be performed, but will most likely be slowed down. All index updates will be stopped. It is recommended to schedule optimization:

listitem.para: on an idle system or when the searches are less frequent
after a lot of index modifications

chapter.para: When using a MassIndexer (see ) it will optimize involved indexes by default at the start and at the end of processing; you can change this behavior by using respectively MassIndexer.optimizeAfterPurge and MassIndexer.optimizeOnFinish.

section.title: Automatic optimization
section.para: Hibernate Search can automatically optimize an index after:

listitem.para: a certain amount of operations (insertion, deletion)
or a certain amount of transactions

section.para: The configuration for automatic index optimization can be defined on a global level or per index:
An optimization will be triggered to the Animal index as soon as either:

listitem.para: the number of additions and deletions reaches 1000
the number of transactions reaches 50 (hibernate.search.Animal.optimizer.transaction_limit.max having priority over hibernate.search.default.optimizer.transaction_limit.max)

section.para: If none of these parameters are defined, no optimization is processed automatically.

section.title: Adjusting optimization
section.para: Apache Lucene has a few parameters to influence how optimization is performed. Hibernate Search exposes those parameters.

Further index optimization parameters include:
hibernate.search.[default|<indexname>].indexwriter.[batch|transaction].max_buffered_docs
hibernate.search.[default|<indexname>].indexwriter.[batch|transaction].max_merge_docs
hibernate.search.[default|<indexname>].indexwriter.[batch|transaction].merge_factor
hibernate.search.[default|<indexname>].indexwriter.[batch|transaction].ram_buffer_size
hibernate.search.[default|<indexname>].indexwriter.[batch|transaction].term_index_interval
See for more details.
